    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>After tap to the page to call requestFullScreen while JS in queue to execute HTML form.submit() delayed with queueMicroTask calling synchronous XHR, finally when form.submit() navigate to POST request URL, the omnibox will immediately disappear and hidden.<span class="line"><!---->After tap to the page to call requestFullScreen while JS in queue to execute HTML form.submit() delayed with queueMicroTask calling synchronous XHR, finally when form.submit() navigate to POST request URL, the omnibox will immediately disappear and hidden.<!----></span><br><br>Interestingly, when put up spoof omnibox after the omnibox is hidden, it looks convincing that the spoof omnibox is legit (as on attached video). <span class="line"><!---->Interestingly, when put up spoof omnibox after the omnibox is hidden, it looks convincing that the spoof omnibox is legit (as on attached video). <!----></span><br><br>However as the testcase using delay execution method, currently there are still chance for the omnibox still visible after navigate to POST request URL. on current testcase I think it has to do with the XHR timing GET delay?[value]. <span class="line"><!---->However as the testcase using delay execution method, currently there are still chance for the omnibox still visible after navigate to POST request URL. on current testcase I think it has to do with the XHR timing GET delay?[value]. <!----></span><br><br>This similar to <span class="line"><!---->This similar to <!----></span>bug 639702<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=639702" title="Chrome for Android - Quickly entering and exiting fullscreen allows for URL Spoofing"><!---->bug 639702<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>which hide omnibox after tap to the page.<span class="line"><!---->which hide omnibox after tap to the page.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>- Chrome 95.0.4638.74; Android 11; Mi 9T<span class="line"><!---->- Chrome 95.0.4638.74; Android 11; Mi 9T<!----></span><br>- Chrome 95.0.4638.74; Android 6.0 (Google APIs); Android Emulator x86<span class="line"><!---->- Chrome 95.0.4638.74; Android 6.0 (Google APIs); Android Emulator x86<!----></span><br>- Chrome Dev 97.0.4692.10; Android 11; Mi 9T<span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Dev 97.0.4692.10; Android 11; Mi 9T<!----></span><br>- Chrome Dev 97.0.4692.10; Android 11; SM-J500F (2015 device)<span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Dev 97.0.4692.10; Android 11; SM-J500F (2015 device)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download and extract hideomniboxspoof.zip<span class="line"><!---->1. Download and extract hideomniboxspoof.zip<!----></span><br>2. Open terminal in extract directory<span class="line"><!---->2. Open terminal in extract directory<!----></span><br>3. Run "node app.js" to serve the webserver<span class="line"><!---->3. Run "node app.js" to serve the webserver<!----></span><br>4. Visit the webserver ipaddress:8000 (i.e. 127.0.0.1:8000)<span class="line"><!---->4. Visit the webserver ipaddress:8000 (i.e. 127.0.0.1:8000)<!----></span><br>5. Tap anywhere on the page<span class="line"><!---->5. Tap anywhere on the page<!----></span><br>6. Omnibox will hide immediately then spoofed with spoof omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->6. Omnibox will hide immediately then spoofed with spoof omnibox.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Irvan Kurniawan (sourc7)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Irvan Kurniawan (sourc7)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270593#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 8, 2021, 7:02 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

        The hack devised a way to hide the toolbar controls by exploiting a subtle timing issue in handling fullscreen.<span class="line"><!---->The hack devised a way to hide the toolbar controls by exploiting a subtle timing issue in handling fullscreen.<!----></span><br><br>The fullscreen request puts Chrome into persistent fullscreen mode and hides toolbar first. The actual fullscreen mode is entered once the toolbar gets hidden as the second step. But the form.submit (loading the spoof page) that immediately follows the fullscreen request resets the process in the middle[1]. Therefore the toolbar gets hidden but the next step cannot proceed, leading to the effect of toolbar left hidden after the spoof page is loaded.<span class="line"><!---->The fullscreen request puts Chrome into persistent fullscreen mode and hides toolbar first. The actual fullscreen mode is entered once the toolbar gets hidden as the second step. But the form.submit (loading the spoof page) that immediately follows the fullscreen request resets the process in the middle[1]. Therefore the toolbar gets hidden but the next step cannot proceed, leading to the effect of toolbar left hidden after the spoof page is loaded.<!----></span><br><br>Do we always show toolbar (omnibox) when a new URL is loaded? Then the solution would be as simple as ensuring it gets visible upon TabObserver.onPageLoadFinished.<span class="line"><!---->Do we always show toolbar (omnibox) when a new URL is loaded? Then the solution would be as simple as ensuring it gets visible upon TabObserver.onPageLoadFinished.<!----></span><br><br>[1] exitFullscreen() is invoked here, and resets variables containing the pending fullscreen state.<span class="line"><!---->[1] exitFullscreen() is invoked here, and resets variables containing the pending fullscreen state.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Here is the flow I observed when the problem happens:<span class="line"><!---->Here is the flow I observed when the problem happens:<!----></span><br><br>Tapping the screen initiates a fullscreen request. Since the browser controls are not hidden, it only sets the persistent fullscreen mode to true, sets the pending fullscreen option, and returns: <span class="line"><!---->Tapping the screen initiates a fullscreen request.         > This is hiding the controls?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This is hiding the controls?<!----></span><br><br>> Is there any way to cancel or reverse this since we technically should have exited fullscreen already and therefore don't want controls hidden.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Is there any way to cancel or reverse this since we technically should have exited fullscreen already and therefore don't want controls hidden.<!----></span><br><br>It is not easy to see what triggered this offset change when the event is invoked. I wonder if we should actually be reshowing the controls at this point?<!----></span><br><br>This sounds more promising.           Comment 23<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270593#c23">Comment 23<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      jinsu...@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->jinsu...@chromium.org<!----></span>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270593#c23">Comment 23<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 5, 2022, 11:19 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270593#c23">Comment 23<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 5, 2022, 11:19 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        |mPendingFullscreenOption| is nulled out both when fullscreen request gets canceled in the middle at pending state[1]  and when fullscreen is entered successfully[2].  Therefore it is not possible to tell the two cases apart - whether we are back in normal screen mode by a canceled request or by exit after a successful fullscreen mode.  <span class="line"><!---->|mPendingFullscreenOption| is nulled out both when fullscreen request gets canceled in the middle at pending state[1]  and when fullscreen is entered successfully[2].  Therefore it is not possible to tell the two cases apart - whether we are back in normal screen mode by a canceled request or by exit after a successful fullscreen mode.  <!----></span><br><br>> In the failure case for this bug, since we start with a call to #enterPersistentFullscreenMode (right?), I wonder if we could explore setting up some tracking in FullscreemHtmlApiHandler to know that we started entering fullscreen mode & never finished when #maybeEnterFullscreenFromPendingState is called.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; In the failure case for this bug, since we start with a call to #enterPersistentFullscreenMode (right?), I wonder if we could explore setting up some tracking in FullscreemHtmlApiHandler to know that we started entering fullscreen mode &amp; never finished when #maybeEnterFullscreenFromPendingState is called.<!----></span><br><br>Ack. The approach I'm taking in<span class="line"><!---->Ack. The approach I'm taking in<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/3362010<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3362010"><!---->crrev.com/c/3362010<!----></a> is, instead of nulling out |mPendingFullscreenOption| for a canceled fullscreen request, it flips a flag inside the option to record the cancel event. This is for FullscreenHtmlApiHandler internal use only, invisible to the classes outside the package that reference the option object (not used by the equality either). The flag then can be used later in #maybeEnterFullscreenFromPendingState to restore the omnibox for the situation in interest. Only after then, the option gets nulled out.<span class="line"><!----> is, instead of nulling out |mPendingFullscreenOption| for a canceled fullscreen request, it flips a flag inside the option to record the cancel event. This is for FullscreenHtmlApiHandler internal use only, invisible to the classes outside the package that reference the option object (not used by the equality either). The flag then can be used later in #maybeEnterFullscreenFromPendingState to restore the omnibox for the situation in interest. Only after then, the option gets nulled out.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=378;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=378;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=378;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=363;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=363;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=363;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          padding: 0;

          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          mr-issue-metadata {

            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;

        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          Editors:<th title="this lists the set of people who are allowed to edit the issues "><!---->Editors:</th>

        <tr>

        Description #1 by susah...@gmail.com (Nov 15, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>After tap to the page to call requestFullScreen while JS in queue to execute HTML form.submit() delayed with queueMicroTask calling synchronous XHR, finally when form.submit() navigate to POST request URL, the omnibox will immediately disappear and hidden.<span class="line"><!---->After tap to the page to call requestFullScreen while JS in queue to execute HTML form.submit() delayed with queueMicroTask calling synchronous XHR, finally when form.submit() navigate to POST request URL, the omnibox will immediately disappear and hidden.<!----></span><br><br>Interestingly, when put up spoof omnibox after the omnibox is hidden, it looks convincing that the spoof omnibox is legit (as on attached video). <span class="line"><!---->Interestingly, when put up spoof omnibox after the omnibox is hidden, it looks convincing that the spoof omnibox is legit (as on attached video). <!----></span><br><br>However as the testcase using delay execution method, currently there are still chance for the omnibox still visible after navigate to POST request URL. on current testcase I think it has to do with the XHR timing GET delay?[value]. <span class="line"><!---->However as the testcase using delay execution method, currently there are still chance for the omnibox still visible after navigate to POST request URL. on current testcase I think it has to do with the XHR timing GET delay?[value]. <!----></span><br><br>This similar to <span class="line"><!---->This similar to <!----></span>bug 639702<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=639702" title="Chrome for Android - Quickly entering and exiting fullscreen allows for URL Spoofing"><!---->bug 639702<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>which hide omnibox after tap to the page.<span class="line"><!---->which hide omnibox after tap to the page.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>- Chrome 95.0.4638.74; Android 11; Mi 9T<span class="line"><!---->- Chrome 95.0.4638.74; Android 11; Mi 9T<!----></span><br>- Chrome 95.0.4638.74; Android 6.0 (Google APIs); Android Emulator x86<span class="line"><!---->- Chrome 95.0.4638.74; Android 6.0 (Google APIs); Android Emulator x86<!----></span><br>- Chrome Dev 97.0.4692.10; Android 11; Mi 9T<span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Dev 97.0.4692.10; Android 11; Mi 9T<!----></span><br>- Chrome Dev 97.0.4692.10; Android 11; SM-J500F (2015 device)<span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Dev 97.0.4692.10; Android 11; SM-J500F (2015 device)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download and extract hideomniboxspoof.zip<span class="line"><!---->1. Download and extract hideomniboxspoof.zip<!----></span><br>2. Open terminal in extract directory<span class="line"><!---->2. Open terminal in extract directory<!----></span><br>3. Run "node app.js" to serve the webserver<span class="line"><!---->3. Run "node app.js" to serve the webserver<!----></span><br>4. Visit the webserver ipaddress:8000 (i.e. 127.0.0.1:8000)<span class="line"><!---->4. Visit the webserver ipaddress:8000 (i.e. 127.0.0.1:8000)<!----></span><br>5. Tap anywhere on the page<span class="line"><!---->5. Tap anywhere on the page<!----></span><br>6. Omnibox will hide immediately then spoofed with spoof omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->6. Omnibox will hide immediately then spoofed with spoof omnibox.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Irvan Kurniawan (sourc7)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Irvan Kurniawan (sourc7)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        jinsukkim: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress.         by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270593#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 8, 2021, 7:02 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270593#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Dec 8, 2021, 7:02 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The hack devised a way to hide the toolbar controls by exploiting a subtle timing issue in handling fullscreen.<span class="line"><!---->The hack devised a way to hide the toolbar controls by exploiting a subtle timing issue in handling fullscreen.<!----></span><br><br>The fullscreen request puts Chrome into persistent fullscreen mode and hides toolbar first. The actual fullscreen mode is entered once the toolbar gets hidden as the second step. But the form.submit (loading the spoof page) that immediately follows the fullscreen request resets the process in the middle[1]. Therefore the toolbar gets hidden but the next step cannot proceed, leading to the effect of toolbar left hidden after the spoof page is loaded.<span class="line"><!---->The fullscreen request puts Chrome into persistent fullscreen mode and hides toolbar first. The actual fullscreen mode is entered once the toolbar gets hidden as the second step. But the form.submit (loading the spoof page) that immediately follows the fullscreen request resets the process in the middle[1]. Therefore the toolbar gets hidden but the next step cannot proceed, leading to the effect of toolbar left hidden after the spoof page is loaded.<!----></span><br><br>Do we always show toolbar (omnibox) when a new URL is loaded? Then the solution would be as simple as ensuring it gets visible upon TabObserver.onPageLoadFinished.<span class="line"><!---->Do we always show toolbar (omnibox) when a new URL is loaded? Then the solution would be as simple as ensuring it gets visible upon TabObserver.onPageLoadFinished.<!----></span><br><br>[1] exitFullscreen() is invoked here, and resets variables containing the pending fullscreen state.<span class="line"><!---->[1] exitFullscreen() is invoked here, and resets variables containing the pending fullscreen state.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        This is gold. Are you fixing this, Jinsuk, or do you someone else should take a look?         Here is the flow I observed when the problem happens:<span class="line"><!---->Here is the flow I observed when the problem happens:<!----></span><br><br>Tapping the screen initiates a fullscreen request. Since the browser controls are not hidden, it only sets the persistent fullscreen mode to true, sets the pending fullscreen option, and returns: <span class="line"><!---->Tapping the screen initiates a fullscreen request. Since the browser controls are not hidden, it only sets the persistent fullscreen mode to true, sets the pending fullscreen option, and returns: <!----></span><br><br>12-20 21:00:23.624 27537 27537 I crdebug : enter-persistent-fullscreen persistent-mode: false control-hidden: false option: false<span class="line"><!---->12-20 21:00:23.624 27537 27537 I crdebug : enter-persistent-fullscreen persistent-mode: false control-hidden: false option: false<!----></span><br>12-20 21:00:23.625 27537 27537 I crdebug : 1] enterPersistentFullscreenMode(FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java:339)<span class="line"><!---->12-20 21:00:23.625 27537 27537 I crdebug : 1] enterPersistentFullscreenMode(FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java:339)<!----></span><br>12-20 21:00:23.625 27537 27537 I crdebug : 2] lambda$onEnterFullscreen$0$org-chromium-chrome-browser-fullscreen-FullscreenHtmlApiHandler(FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java:276)<span class="line"><!---->12-20 21:00:23.625 27537 27537 I crdebug : 2] lambda$onEnterFullscreen$0$org-chromium-chrome-browser-fullscreen-FullscreenHtmlApiHandler(FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java:276)<!----></span><br>12-20 21:00:23.625 27537 27537 I crdebug : 3] run(Unknown         > This is hiding the controls?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This is hiding the controls?<!----></span><br><br>> Is there any way to cancel or reverse this since we technically should have exited fullscreen already and therefore don't want controls hidden.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Is there any way to cancel or reverse this since we technically should have exited fullscreen already and therefore don't want controls hidden.<!----></span><br><br>It is not easy to see what triggered this offset change when the event is invoked. I wonder if we should actually be reshowing the controls at this point?<!----></span><br><br>This sounds more promising.         Unfortunately the CL above had a regression <span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately the CL above had a regression <!----></span>Issue 1283531<span class="line"><!---->Issue 1283531<!----></span>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.maybeEnterFullscreenFromPendingState is also called with the same boolean |controlsHidden|(true) when entering the persistent fullscreen mode by the page being scrolled down.           Comment 23<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270593#c23">Comment 23<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      jinsu...@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1717598733" title="jinsu...@chromium.org"><!---->jinsu...@chromium.org<!----></a>
      jinsu...@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->jinsu...@chromium.org<!----></span>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270593#c23">Comment 23<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 5, 2022, 11:19 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270593#c23">Comment 23<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 5, 2022, 11:19 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        |mPendingFullscreenOption| is nulled out both when fullscreen request gets canceled in the middle at pending state[1]  and when fullscreen is entered successfully[2].  Therefore it is not possible to tell the two cases apart - whether we are back in normal screen mode by a canceled request or by exit after a successful fullscreen mode.  <span class="line"><!---->|mPendingFullscreenOption| is nulled out both when fullscreen request gets canceled in the middle at pending state[1]  and when fullscreen is entered successfully[2].  Therefore it is not possible to tell the two cases apart - whether we are back in normal screen mode by a canceled request or by exit after a successful fullscreen mode.  <!----></span><br><br>> In the failure case for this bug, since we start with a call to #enterPersistentFullscreenMode (right?), I wonder if we could explore setting up some tracking in FullscreemHtmlApiHandler to know that we started entering fullscreen mode & never finished when #maybeEnterFullscreenFromPendingState is called.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; In the failure case for this bug, since we start with a call to #enterPersistentFullscreenMode (right?), I wonder if we could explore setting up some tracking in FullscreemHtmlApiHandler to know that we started entering fullscreen mode &amp; never finished when #maybeEnterFullscreenFromPendingState is called.<!----></span><br><br>Ack. The approach I'm taking in<span class="line"><!---->Ack. The approach I'm taking in<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/3362010<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3362010"><!---->crrev.com/c/3362010<!----></a> is, instead of nulling out |mPendingFullscreenOption| for a canceled fullscreen request, it flips a flag inside the option to record the cancel event. This is for FullscreenHtmlApiHandler internal use only, invisible to the classes outside the package that reference the option object (not used by the equality either). The flag then can be used later in #maybeEnterFullscreenFromPendingState to restore the omnibox for the situation in interest. Only after then, the option gets nulled out.<span class="line"><!----> is, instead of nulling out |mPendingFullscreenOption| for a canceled fullscreen request, it flips a flag inside the option to record the cancel event. This is for FullscreenHtmlApiHandler internal use only, invisible to the classes outside the package that reference the option object (not used by the equality either). The flag then can be used later in #maybeEnterFullscreenFromPendingState to restore the omnibox for the situation in interest. Only after then, the option gets nulled out.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=378;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=378;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=378;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=363;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=363;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/fullscreen/FullscreenHtmlApiHandler.java;l=363;drc=affba65e089bc0d7c2c1720f6d12e12a5cf32ae0<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {

            flex-direction: column;

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

            flex-direction: column;
          }

            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
